Submodules

rigel.exceptions module

exception rigel.exceptions.ClientError(client: str, exception: Exception)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an error occurs while using a client.

Variables:

  • client – The client that raised the exception.

  • exception – The exception raised by the client.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.DockerAPIError(exception: Exception)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an exception is thrown while making a call to the Docker API.

Variables:

exception – The exception thrown by the Docker API.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.EmptyRigelfileError[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an empty Rigelfile is found.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.InvalidValueError(field: str, value: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is made to pass an invalid value to a given field.

Variables:

  • field – The name of the unsupported compiler.

  • value – The name of the unsupported compiler.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.PluginNotCompliantError(plugin: str, cause: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an plugin is loaded that is not compliant with the rigel.plugins.Protocol class.

Variables:

  • plugin – Name of the plugin

  • cause – Reason why plugin is not compliant.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.PluginNotFoundError(plugin: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is made to load a plugin that is not installed.

Variables:

plugin – Name of the plugin.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.PydanticValidationError(exception: ValidationError)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever a ValidationError is thrown while creating instances of pydantic.BaseModel.

Variables:

exception – The exception thrown.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.RigelError(base: str = 'Generic Rigel error.')[source]

Bases: Exception

The base exception class for all Rigel errors.

Variables:

  • base – The error message.

  • code – The error code.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.RigelfileNotFoundError[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever a Rigelfile is required but is not found.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.UndeclaredEnvironmentVariableError(env: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is made to use the value of an undeclared environment variable.

Variables:

env – The undeclared environment variable.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.UndeclaredGlobalVariableError(field: str, var: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an undeclared global variable is referenced.

Variables:

  • field – Path for the field referencing the global varialble.

  • var – Global variable identifier.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.UnformattedRigelfileError(trace: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is made to use an unformatted Rigelfile.

Variables:

trace – A message detailing what format error was found and where.

base: str
exception rigel.exceptions.UnsupportedCompilerError(compiler: str)[source]

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is made to use an unsupported compiler.

Variables:

compiler – The name of the unsupported compiler.

base: str

Bases: RigelError

Raised whenever an attempt is build an image for an unsupported platform.

Variables:

compiler – The unsupported platform.

rigel.workspace module

class rigel.workspace.WorkspaceManager(path: str)[source]

Bases: object

connect_providers() → None[source]

Initialize and connect to all declared providers.

disconnect_providers() → None[source]

Disconnect from all declared providers.

execute_plugin(job: str) → None[source]

Run the plugin associated with a given job.

Parameters:

job (str) – The job identifier.

handle_abort(*args: Any) → None[source]

Handle abort events. Ensure that executing plugin is properly terminated and disconnect from all declared providers.

handle_signals() → None[source]

Start listening for abort (CTRL-C and CTRL-Z) events.

initializate_providers() → None[source]
run_job(job: str) → None[source]

Run a single job.

Parameters:

job (str) – The job identifier.

run_sequence(sequence: str) → None[source]

Run a sequence of jobs.

Parameters:

sequence (str) – The sequence identifier.
